page.title: 14 Bawbee Bridge
page.content: The River Leven is crossed by the Bawbee Bridge.So called because until 1870 the fee for crossing the bridge was one Bawbee (Bawbee_Scots word for ha'penny,L.S.D.). The original was a suspension bridge built in 1821 it was replaced by another bridge in 1839.About 120 years later in the 1950's traffic was growing,the bridge was narrow and only one car could pass at a time,also the bridge required a lot of repairs so it was decided to build another bridge. Work was started in 1955 and this bridge was finished in 1957 at a cost of Â£200,000.It was declared opened by the Secretary of State for Scotland at the time Mr John.S.Mackay and is still being used as the main communication link from Leven to Methil.
